body.p: His Excellency Thomas E Bramlett Gov of Ky

Your Petitioner H T Burk would represent to your excellency that he was engaged in retailing Spirits for a short time during the Winter and Spring of the present year that he procured a licens from the Trustees of the Town of Monticello for the privilege of retailing and also paid the general Government Tax. but with that at the Apl Term of the Wayne circuit Court from same cause the Grand Jury found a true bill against him for Tipling that at the last october Term he was late getting to Town, on the first day of the Court and when he got to Town Judgement had been rendered against him for $20 -- he would most respectfully ask your excellence under the circumstances to remit Said fine and as in duty bound will ever be your friend
I John L Sallee Clerk of the Wayne County Court do certify that the above Statements are of my own knowledge all true
att Jno L Salle C W Ct C

Wayne Cir Ct
vs
H. T. Burk
$20,
Tipling
Remitted 4th Nov/65
